results.title: Pretreatment with simvastatin reduces myocardial no-reflow by opening mitochondrial K(ATP) channel.
results.text_hl: Pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@myocardial no-reflow@@@ by opening mitochondrial K(ATP) channel.

results.title: Statin therapy and myocardial no-reflow.
results.text_hl: In this present issue of the British Journal of Pharmacology, Zhao and colleagues provide a novel mechanism of action for statins with the observation that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial@@@ '@<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@' after @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and reperfusion by activating the mitochondrial K(ATP) channel.

citations.NLM: Calvert JW, Lefer DJ. Statin therapy and myocardial no-reflow. Br J Pharmacol. 2006 Oct;149(3):229-31. PMID: 16921390
citations.BibTeX: @article{16921390, title={Statin therapy and myocardial no-reflow.}, author={Calvert JW and Lefer DJ}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={149}, number={3}, pages={229-31}}

results.title: [Effects and potential mechanisms of short-term use of simvastatin on myocardial no-reflow after ischemia-reperfusion in rats].
results.journal: Zhonghua Xin Xue Guan Bing Za Zhi
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: The main objective of this study is to assess the the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@sim@@@) on @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@myocardial no-reflow@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@NR@@@) and explore the possible potential mechanisms.

citations.NLM: Liu YH, Zhang M, Liu LM, Zhou X, Jiao ZQ, Li YM, Pang W. [Effects and potential mechanisms of short-term use of simvastatin on myocardial no-reflow after ischemia-reperfusion in rats]. Zhonghua Xin Xue Guan Bing Za Zhi. 2008 Aug;36(8):729-34. PMID: 19100117

results.title: The cardioprotection of simvastatin in reperfused swine hearts relates to the inhibition of myocardial edema by modulating aquaporins via the PKA pathway.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ pretreatment reduced the sizes of @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ and @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ areas by 18.5% and 11.1% (P<0.01), decreased @CHEMICAL_Water @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014867 @@@water@@@ content in the left ventricle, reflow and @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ myocardium by 1.4%, 5.3%, and 4.3% (P<0.05), inhibited cardiomyocytes swelling in the reflow and @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ areas by 19.8% and 13.1% (P<0.01), suppressed mitochondrial @CHEMICAL_Water @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014867 @@@water@@@ accumulation in the reflow and @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ areas by 49.0% and 35.9% (P<0.01), increased @GENE_PRKACA @GENE_397652 @@@PKA@@@ activity (P<0.01), and blocked the up-regulation of @GENE_AQP1 @GENE_407773;100126277;100739420;100127153 @@@aquaporin-1, -4, -8, and -9@@@ in the reflow and @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ myocardium.

citations.NLM: Li XD, Yang YJ, Geng YJ, Cheng YT, Zhang HT, Zhao JL, Yuan JQ, Gao RL. The cardioprotection of simvastatin in reperfused swine hearts relates to the inhibition of myocardial edema by modulating aquaporins via the PKA pathway. Int J Cardiol. 2013 Sep 10;167(6):2657-66. PMID: 22819122
citations.BibTeX: @article{22819122, title={The cardioprotection of simvastatin in reperfused swine hearts relates to the inhibition of myocardial edema by modulating aquaporins via the PKA pathway.}, author={Li XD and Yang YJ and Geng YJ and Cheng YT and Zhang HT and Zhao JL and Yuan JQ and Gao RL}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={167}, number={6}, pages={2657-66}}

results.title: Cerebral blood flow changes after brain injury in human amyloid-beta knock-in mice.
results.text_hl: We used arterial spin-labeling magnetic resonance imaging to examine if @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@CBF@@@ changes after @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ are influenced by @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @GENE_APP @GENE_351 @@@Abeta@@@ and amenable to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy.

results.title: Donor simvastatin treatment abolishes rat cardiac allograft ischemia/reperfusion injury and chronic rejection through microvascular protection.
results.text_hl: Donor, but not recipient, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment prevented @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@/@DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@reperfusion injury@@@-induced vascular leakage, leukocyte infiltration, the @<m>DISEASE_No_Reflow_Phenomenon</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054318 @@@no-reflow@@@ phenomenon, and @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial injury@@@.

results.title: Intensive cholesterol lowering with statin improves the outcomes of percutaneous coronary intervention in patients with acute coronary syndrome.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ in the SS group received 20 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ in the IS group received 80 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for 7 days before PCI.
